What crops is this useful for?: The pesticide is useful for a variety of crops including Alfalfa, Almonds, Apples, Asparagus, Beans, Peas, Boysenberries, Raspberries, Strawberries, Carrots, Onions, Garlic, Cherries, Corn, Small grains (barley, oats, rye, wheat), Sorghum, Soybeans, Cotton, Citrus, Grapes, Melons, Peaches, Nectarines, Peanuts, Pears, Plums, Prunes, Potatoes, Sugar beets, Tomatoes, and Ornamental Roses.
First aid information?: If swallowed, call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. If in eyes, rinse slowly and gently with water for 15 to 20 minutes. If on skin or clothing, rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15 to 20 minutes. Always have the product container or label with you when calling a poison control center or doctor.
What special restrictions are placed on: The product should not be applied directly to water or to areas where surface water is present or to intertidal areas below the mean high water mark. It should not contaminate water when disposing of rinsate or equipment wash waters.
What PPE should I wear?: Applicators and other handlers must wear: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants, chemical resistant gloves made of waterproof material such as polyethylene or polyvinyl chloride, shoes plus socks and protective eyewear.
How does the product have to be stored o: The product should be stored in a cool, dry area away from any heat or ignition source. It should not be stacked over 2 pallets high. The product should not be allowed to become wet or to be stored in a damp, humid area. For disposal, wastes resulting from the use of this product may be disposed of on site or at an approved waste disposal facility.
